meanings.definition: To agree or consent to a demand or proposal.
meanings.sent1: After much persuasion, she finally decided to reaccede to their request.
meanings.sent2: The company had no choice but to reaccede to the new regulations.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't resist the delicious smell of the cookies, so he had to reaccede to having one more.
meanings.sent4: The stubborn old tree finally had to reaccede to the strong winds and bend gracefully.
meanings.sent5: The king had to reaccede to the demands of his people to maintain peace in the kingdom.

meanings.definition: To return to a former position or status.
meanings.sent1: After his resignation, he was able to reaccede to his previous role in the company.
meanings.sent2: The athlete trained hard to reaccede to his position as the champion.
meanings.sent3: The lost toy magically reacceded to its spot on the shelf overnight.
meanings.sent4: The river reacceded to reveal the hidden treasure buried beneath its waters.
meanings.sent5: The sun reacceded behind the clouds, casting a shadow over the town.
